channel.title: CSS Positioning and CSS Colors on FEWD
channel.description: Recent content in CSS Positioning and CSS Colors on FEWD

item.title: Objectives
item.description: Introduce CSS Colors Discuss CSS Positioning Understand how to handle background images

item.title: Agenda
item.description: Review last class Review Layout Challenge CSS Colors CSS Positioning Background Images Code Along Lab

item.title: Last Class Review
item.description: Topics We Covered Last Class Block, Inline and Inline-Block elements Containing elements:<div> and semantic tags CSS Floats Block, Inline and Inline-Block elements Block Level Elements By default, block elements take up an entire row regardless of the width of their content Example block elements: <p>, <h1>, <div> Full list of block level elements can be found here Inline Elements

item.title: Layout Challenge Review
item.description: We’ll review the “solutions” for the layout challenge. The solutions can be found in the following folder: starter_code/layout_challenge_solution

item.title: CSS Colors
item.description: Specifying Colors in CSS Several ways to express colors in CSS Color Names Hex Codes RGB, RGBa HSL, HSLa Color Names colors represented by predefined names 147 color names this approach is limited h1 { color: green } Hex Codes colors represented by values for red, green and blue in hexadecimal code h1 { color: #66cdaa } RGB colors represented by values for red, green and blue expressed as numbers between 0 and 255 h1 { color: rgb(102, 205, 170) } RGBa Leverages CSS3 inclusion of the opacity property Just like RGB but allows you to specify the opacity as the fourth value (alpha value) alpha must be a number between 0.

item.title: CSS Positioning
item.description: CSS Positioning Normal Flow Default way browser handles block-level elements Each block-level element sits on top of the next one If width is not specified, element will span the width of its container JS Bin on jsbin.com Relative Positioning Moves element in relation to where it would have been in normal flow Uses offset properties (top or bottom and left or right) to indicate how far to move the element from where it would have been in normal flow

item.title: Background Images
item.description: background-image Property background-image property allows you to place an image behind any HTML element Image can be “behind” the entire page or part of a page By default a background image will repeat to fill an entire box body { /* this image will be applied to the entire page */ background-image: url("images/cool-background-image.gif"); } .hero-section { /* this image will be applied to container with a "hero-section" class attribute */ background-image: url("images/another-cool-background-image.

item.title: Code Along
item.description: Code Along #2: Fashion Blog II Using Sublime, open the folder called fashion_blog_part_II (found within the starter_code) folder As a class, we’ll add a column to the fashion blog layout to match the layout in image depicted below.

item.title: Lab
item.description: Lab: Relaxr Blog Work in teams (2 to 3 students) to recreate the html page depicted in the image below. The files for this lab can be found in the following folder: starter_code/relaxr_blog
